php.LBL_CONFREPORT_DESCRIPTION: Permets de vérifier que les paramètres actuels sont alignés avec ceux recommandés.
php.LBL_SYSTEM_STABILITY: Configuration de la stabilité du système
php.LBL_SYSTEM_SECURITY: Configuration de la sécurité du système
php.LBL_SECURITY_ADVISORIES_CHECKER: Failles de sécurité dans les bibliothèques utilisées
php.LBL_EXIF_LIBRARY: Exif (améliore la sécurité des fichiers téléchargés)
php.LBL_LABEL_CRM_DATE: Date de sortie de la version
php.LBL_HELP_CACERTBUNDLE: The parameter determines whether a repository of trusted certification authorities (CA) is available for verification of external service certificates.
php.LBL_HELP_MBSTRING: Extension used to manage strings. Used to convert strings to different encodings.
php.LBL_HELP_FILTER: Extension utilisée pour filtrer les données de requête entrantes.
php.LBL_HELP_HTTPS: SSL est la technologie de sécurité standard pour établir un lien chiffré entre un serveur Web et un navigateur
php.LBL_HELP_DISPLAY_ERRORS: Error messages and warnings will be sent to the browser. They often include sensitive technical information about the system and must never be available to untrusted sources. This option should only be enabled in the test or developer version to display errors and warnings.
php.LBL_HELP_SESSION_COOKIE_HTTPONLY: Session cookie files are only available via HTTP protocol. This setting can sufficiently prevent identity theft resulting from XSS attacks.
php.LBL_HELP_SESSION_USE_ONLY_COOKIES: Sets getting ID only from cookies. Enabling it prevents from attacks based on sending session IDs in URLs.
php.LBL_HELP_EXPOSE_PHP: Determines if the PHP server sends PHP version number in headers. This information might make the server more vulnerable to attacks, therefore we recommend disabling this option.
php.LBL_HELP__HTACCESS: Les fichiers .htaccess peuvent être utilisés pour modifier la configuration du logiciel serveur pour configurer et activer / désactiver des services supplémentaires. YetiForceCRM nécessite l'accès au fichier à certaines fonctions de travail correctement.
php.LBL_HELP_PUBLIC_HTML: Nous vous suggérons d'installer le système de sorte que seul le dossier public_html soit utilisé. Cela améliore la sécurité des données en n'ayant pas accès aux répertoires et fichiers non publics directement à partir de l'adresse
php.LBL_HELP_SESSION_REGENERATE_ID: Nous vous recommandons d'activer la régénération de l'identifiant de session, cette option rend difficile la prise en charge de la session utilisateur. Les modifications doivent être effectuées dans le fichier de configuration principal.
php.LBL_HELP_SESSION_USE_STRICT_MODE: The server will reject uninitiated sessions. We recommend enabling this option for safety reasons.
php.LBL_HELP_SESSION_USE_TRANS_SID: Sets transferring the ID in the URL and webforms. We recommend disabling this option for safety reasons.
php.LBL_HELP_HEADER_X_FRAME_OPTIONS: The "SAMEORIGIN" value means that the page will load in “frame” only from the same domain. It protects from “clickjacking” attacks.
php.LBL_HELP_HEADER_X_XSS_PROTECTION: Protects from XSS attacks. For option "1; mode=block" in case XSS attack is detected page rendering will be stopped.
php.LBL_HELP_HEADER_X_CONTENT_TYPE_OPTIONS: MIME types sent in Content-Type headers will not be altered. This option protects from "MIME" attacks.
php.LBL_HELP_HEADER_X_ROBOTS_TAG: Parameter defines behavior of robots. We recommend setting it to “none”, which blocks search indexing by robots.
php.LBL_HELP_HEADER_X_PERMITTED_CROSS_DOMAIN: Specifies how “strategy files” are handled on the server, eg. "crossdomain.xml". The recommended option is no handling  of “strategy files”.
php.LBL_HELP_HEADER_X_POWERED_BY: The header sends information about PHP version. For safety reasons we recommend it to be empty (contain no information).
php.LBL_HELP_HEADER__SERVER: The header sends general information about the server. For safety reasons we recommend it to be empty (contain no information).
php.LBL_HELP_HEADER_REFERRER_POLICY: The Referer header may disclose the CRM's address to third parties. We recommend setting it to “same-origin” that will only display the header from the same domain.
php.LBL_HELP_HEADER_EXPECT_CT: The header determines how certificates are handled on the website. Recommended option is "enforce; max-age=3600" which means that enforcing correctness and validity of the certificate lasts for 3600 seconds.
php.LBL_HELP_HEADER_STRICT_TRANSPORT_SECURIT: The browser should only communicate over HTTPS protocol, not over HTTP protocol. Recommended time for communication only over HTTPS is 31536000 seconds.
php.LBL_HELP_PHPVERSION: Recommended PHP version. We recommend using the latest PHP versions that include all patches and optimizations.
php.LBL_HELP_ERROR_REPORTING: Level of reporting errors and warnings. If it is not set properly logs may take up significant amount of space.
php.LBL_HELP_MAX_EXECUTION_TIME: Maximum PHP script execution time (one request).
php.LBL_HELP_MAX_INPUT_TIME: Maximum input handling time for POST or GET in seconds.
php.LBL_HELP_DEFAULT_SOCKET_TIMEOUT: Maximum time for external server connection in seconds.
php.LBL_HELP_MEMORY_LIMIT: Maximum RAM available for the PHP script.
php.LBL_HELP_LOG_ERROR: Should error notices be saved in server logs.
php.LBL_HELP_FILE_UPLOADS: Should the server allow file upload.
php.LBL_HELP_SHORT_OPEN_TAG: Should short form "<? ?>" at the beginning and the end of PHP files be allowed.
php.LBL_HELP_POST_MAX_SIZE: Maximum size of POST data that can be sent to the server. If the value is too low some data sent to the server may be lost.
php.LBL_HELP_UPLOAD_MAX_FILESIZE: Maximum size of the sent file.
php.LBL_HELP_MAX_INPUT_VARS: Maximum amount of variables that can be sent to the server. This amount applies to each of the  $_GET, $_POST or $_COOKIE tables individually. If the amount is too low some data sent to the server may be lost.
php.LBL_HELP_ZLIB_OUTPUT_COMPRESSION: Should the server compress content sent to the browser.
php.LBL_HELP_SESSION_AUTO_START: Will the session start automatically when the PHP script is executed.
php.LBL_HELP_SESSION_GC_MAXLIFETIME: Time (in seconds) after which the session will be cleared.
php.LBL_HELP_SESSION_GC_DIVISOR: This option works together with session.gc_probability and is used to calculate the probability of launching the "garbage collection" process. The probability is calculated this way: session.gc_probability/gc_divisor.
php.LBL_HELP_SESSION_GC_PROBABILITY: This parameter works together with session.gc_probability and is used to calculate the probability of launching the "garbage collection" process. The probability is calculated this way: session.gc_probability/gc_divisor.
php.LBL_HELP_MBSTRING_FUNC_OVERLOAD: Set of one-byte functions through their mbstring equivalents. We recommend disabling this setting. From PHP 7.2 on this setting will be marked as "deprecated".
php.LBL_HELP_ALLOW_URL_FOPEN: Enables reading data from external servers using a function to read local files. If it is enabled attackers might load files from a server and execute them.
php.LBL_HELP_INNODB_LOCK_WAIT_TIMEOUT: How long (in seconds) InnoDB transaction waits for row lock. An error message will be displayed if the row is still locked after this time passes.
php.LBL_HELP_WAIT_TIMEOUT: How long (in seconds) the server waits for activity during a non-interactive connection before it is closed.
php.LBL_HELP_INTERACTIVE_TIMEOUT: How long (in seconds) the server waits for activity during an interactive connection before it is closed.
php.LBL_HELP_SQL_MODE:
Different modes of working with the database. The modes affect SQL syntax and data validity verification. Must not contain STRICT_TRANS_TABLE and STRICT_ALL_TABLES. 
The system is compatible with the following modes: ONLY_FULL_GROUP_BY, NO_ZERO_IN_DATE, NO_ZERO_DATE, ERROR_FOR_DIVISION_BY_ZERO, NO_AUTO_CREATE_USER, NO_ENGINE_SUBSTITUTION.
php.LBL_HELP_MAX_ALLOWED_PACKET: Maximum size of data sent at once.
php.LBL_HELP_INNODB_FILE_PER_TABLE: Will data be stored in the database in many files, where each table has its own file, contrary to the old approach where all data was stored in one file. This option is enabled by default from MySQL version 5.6.6 on.
php.LBL_HELP_INNODB_STATS_ON_METADATA: Updates stats for InnoDB tables for some queries, for example SHOW TABLE STATUS. Disabling this option improves efficiency for large InnoDB tables. We recommend disabling this option.
php.LBL_HELP_DENY_PUBLIC_DIR: It is recommended to deny access to this directory. Currently, the directory is publicly accessible and its content is not protected.
php.LBL_HELP_AUTO_DETECT_LINE_ENDINGS: It is recommended to enable coding checks when importing files.
php.LBL_HELP_IMAP: Extension required for communication with Mailbox.
php.LBL_HELP_PDO_MYSQL: Extension enabling communication with MySQL database.
php.LBL_HELP_MYSQLND: Extension enabling communication with MySQL database.
php.LBL_HELP_OPENSSL: Library securing communication of computer networks against eavesdropping.
php.LBL_HELP_CURL: Client-side library that allows sending HTTP requests and retrieving pages and files from servers.
php.LBL_HELP_GD: Allows you to modify graphic files and create your own graphics.
php.LBL_HELP_PCRE: Library written in C, which implements a regular expression engine, inspired by the capabilities of the Perl programming language
php.LBL_HELP_XML: Universal language for transferring and storing data.
php.LBL_HELP_JSON: Text format for exchanging computer data.
php.LBL_HELP_DOM: Extension allows to handle XML documents via DOM API with PHP
php.LBL_HELP_ZIP: Allows to read and save compressed ZIP archives and files located in them.
php.LBL_HELP_SOAP: Allows processes running on disparate operating systems to communicate
php.LBL_HELP_FILEINFO: Detects content type and file encoding.
php.LBL_HELP_ICONV: It converts one encodings to any other
php.LBL_HELP_EXIF: Extension enables work with image metadata
php.LBL_HELP_LDAP: Protocol used to access databases that store information in a tree structure.
php.LBL_HELP_OPCACHE: Improves performance by storing compiled byte code in shared memory.
php.LBL_HELP_IMAGICK: Library recommended for securing potentially dangerous graphic files
php.LBL_HELP_OPCACHE_FILE_UPDATE_PROTECTION: Prevents caching files that are less than this number of seconds old.
php.LBL_HELP_OPCACHE_ENABLE_CLI: Enables the opcode cache for the CLI version of PHP
php.LBL_HELP_OPCACHE_MAX_ACCELERATED_FILES: Maximum number of keys in the OPcache hash table
php.LBL_HELP_OPCACHE_INTERNED_STRINGS_BUFFER: Amount of memory used to store interned strings, in megabytes
php.LBL_HELP_OPCACHE_VALIDATE_TIMESTAMPS: Checks for the availability of updated scripts at every update time.
php.LBL_HELP_OPCACHE_REVALIDATE_FREQ: Frequency of checking updates for each request.
php.LBL_HELP_OPCACHE_SAVE_COMMENTS: If disabled, all documentation comments will be discarded from the opcode cache to reduce the size of the optimised code.
php.LBL_HELP_OPCACHE_MEMORY_CONSUMPTION: OPcache shared memory storage size in megabytes
php.LBL_HELP_REALPATH_CACHE_TTL: Duration of time (in seconds) for which to cache realpath information for a given file or directory.
php.LBL_HELP_APC_ENABLED: The Alternative PHP Cache (APC) is a PHP extension that provides opcode caching. By caching the compiled operation codes (opcodes) of PHP scripts, APC enables sites to serve page content significantly faster.
php.LBL_HELP_MAX_CONNECTIONS: Maximum number of simultaneous client connections.
php.LBL_HELP_SERVERVERSION: Version du serveur de base de données
php.LBL_HELP_CLIENTVERSION: Version des bibliothèques clientes utilisées par le pilote PDO.
php.LBL_HELP_SERVERINFO: Information about database server to which PDO is connected.
php.LBL_HELP_BULK_INSERT_BUFFER_SIZE: Size in bytes of cache tree for each thread used to speed up the insertion of batch data into MyISAM and Aria tables. Value 0 disables the cache tree.
php.LBL_HELP_KEY_BUFFER_SIZE: Buffer size for index blocks used by MyISAM arrays and shared for all threads.
php.LBL_HELP_THREAD_CACHE_SIZE: Size of server cache threads to be reused.
php.LBL_HELP_QUERY_CACHE_SIZE: Size in bytes available for the query buffer. About 40 KB are required for query cache structures, so setting a smaller size will result in a warning.
php.LBL_HELP_TMP_TABLE_SIZE: Maximum size for temporary tables in memory
php.LBL_HELP_MAX_HEAP_TABLE_SIZE: Maximum size in bytes for MEMORY tables created by user. Setting the variable when the server is active does not affect existing tables, unless they are recreated or changed.
php.LBL_HELP_INNODB_BUFFER_POOL_INSTANCES: If value in innodb_buffer_pool_size is greater than 1GB, it divides InnoDB buffer pool into multiple instances.
php.LBL_HELP_INNODB_BUFFER_POOL_SIZE: Size of InnoDB buffer pool in bytes.
php.LBL_HELP_INNODB_IO_CAPACITY_MAX: Maximum capacity to which InnodDB can extend innodb_io_capacity in emergency.
php.LBL_HELP_CHARACTER_SET_SERVER: Default character set used by server.
php.LBL_HELP_CHARACTER_SET_DATABASE: Character set used by the default database and set by server after each change of the default database.
php.LBL_HELP_CHARACTER_SET_CLIENT: Specifies character set for queries from client.
php.LBL_HELP_CHARACTER_SET_CONNECTION: Character set used to convert numbers to characters, as well as to literals that do not have an introductory character set.
php.LBL_HELP_CHARACTER_SET_RESULTS: Character set used to display results and error messages from client.
php.LBL_HELP_CHARACTER_SET_SYSTEM: Character set used by server to store identifiers, always set to utf8.
php.LBL_HELP_CHARACTER_SET_FILESYSTEM: Character set for file system. Used to convert filenames specified as a string literal from character_set_client to character_set_filesystem before file opening.
